Check and suppress data

Source: R/confidentiality.R
check_and_suppress.Rd

Check and suppress data

Usage

check_and_suppress(
  dat,
  output,
  project,
  v_id,
  value_var,
  group = NULL,
  rule,
  value,
  type = "code",
  names_to = "name",
  values_to = "value"
)

Arguments

dat

The dataset used to create a summary table. This must include the vessel identifier column.

output

The output table to be suppressed. If output = NULL, dat is used. @param project Name of project.

v_id

String, the name of the vessel identifier column.

value_var

String, the name(s) of the value variable(s).

group

String, the name(s) of the grouping variable(s). This should include the `period` name if summarizing over time.

rule

String, the confidentiality rule to apply. rule = "n" suppresses values containing fewer than n vessels. rule = "k" (the "majority allocation rule") suppresses values where a single vessel contains k percent or more of the total catch.

value

The threshold for confidentiality. for rule = "n" must be an integer of at least 3. For rule = "k" any double value from 0 to 100.

type

String, the value used to replace confidential data. "code" replaces values with -999, "NA" (with quotes) replaces with NA, and "zero" replaces with 0.

names_to

String, the name for the column containing the names of value variables when `value_var` has two or more columns.

values_to

String, the name for the column containing the values from the variables listed in `names_to`.

On this page
